system_context: You're writing landing page copy for Sozee.ai, an AI content generation tool for OnlyFans creators and agencies. Sozee solves the 'content crisis' - the 1/100 ratio of content supply vs fan demand. Key features: Custom LORA training, 1-click photo/video generation, SFW & NSFW support, built specifically for creator platforms.

hero_subtitle.prompt_template:
You're writing landing page copy for Sozee.ai.

Page Type: {pattern_name} (Pattern {pattern_id})
Page Title (H1): {h1}
Variables: {variables}

Write a compelling subtitle (1-2 sentences, max 150 characters) for the hero section.
The subtitle should hook the reader and clearly state the benefit.

Pattern-specific guidance:
- Pattern 1 (Comparison): Emphasize differentiation from competitor
- Pattern 2 (Best): Emphasize top ranking/recommendation
- Pattern 3 (Direct): Emphasize specific tool benefit
- Pattern 4 (Alternative): Emphasize why to switch
- Pattern 5 (Review): Emphasize honest evaluation
- Pattern 6 (Crisis): Emphasize the 1/100 problem

Examples of good subtitles:
- Pattern 1: 'Both promise AI content. Only one solves the content crisis.'
- Pattern 2: 'Stop begging creators for content. Generate unlimited photos in their likeness.'
- Pattern 3: 'Turn 1 photoshoot into 10,000 photos. Same face. Same body. Infinite possibilities.'
- Pattern 6: 'Your agency's growth is limited by one thing: content supply. Not anymore.'

Output ONLY the subtitle text, nothing else.

problem_agitation.prompt_template:
You're writing landing page copy for Sozee.ai.

Page Type: {pattern_name} (Pattern {pattern_id})
Page Title: {h1}
Variables: {variables}
Viral Hook: {viral_hook}

Write the problem agitation section (3-4 paragraphs + 3 bullet points).

Use the viral hook as your opening sentence or headline.
Then agitate the pain points relevant to this audience and pattern.
End with a transition to the Sozee solution.

Pain points by audience:
- Agencies: Revenue instability, creator dependency, scaling challenges, wasted time
- Creators: Burnout, time pressure, production costs, creative limits, income tied to shoots
- Models: Physical availability limits, location constraints, perfectionism pressure

Format:
{viral_hook}

[Paragraph 1: Set up the problem using emotional/relatable language]

[Paragraph 2: Agitate the pain - make it real and urgent]

[Paragraph 3: Continue agitation or show failed solutions]

• [Specific pain point 1]
• [Specific pain point 2]
• [Specific pain point 3]

[Transition sentence to Sozee solution]

Example for Pattern 1 (Comparison):
'If you're an OnlyFans creator, you've probably heard about Higgsfield. Maybe you've even tried it. But here's the reality: Higgsfield is built for AI enthusiasts and developers, not creators like you.

The learning curve is steep. The interface is complex. The results are inconsistent. You spend more time fighting with the tool than actually creating content.

You've watched tutorials for hours. You've joined Discord communities. You've tweaked parameters until 2am. And still, your content doesn't look professional enough to post.

• Complex prompt engineering required
• No NSFW optimization for creator content
• Generic results that don't look like you

That's where Sozee is fundamentally different.'

Output the full formatted section.

faq.prompt_template:
You're writing FAQ content for a Sozee.ai landing page.

Page Type: {pattern_name} (Pattern {pattern_id})
Page Title: {h1}
Variables: {variables}

Write 5 pattern-specific FAQ questions and answers.

Pattern-specific question types:
- Pattern 1 (Comparison): Focus on differences vs {competitor}
  * How is Sozee different from {competitor}?
  * Is Sozee easier to use than {competitor}?
  * Can I switch from {competitor} to Sozee?
  * What features does Sozee have that {competitor} doesn't?
  * Which is better for {platform} creators?

- Pattern 2 (Best): Focus on why it's the best
  * What makes this the best {use_case} for {audience}?
  * How does Sozee compare to other tools?
  * Why should {audience} choose Sozee?
  * Is Sozee really better than competitors?
  * What do users say about Sozee?

- Pattern 3 (Direct): Focus on how the tool works
  * How does the {tool_type} work?
  * Is this optimized for {platform}?
  * How realistic will my content look?
  * How fast can I generate content?
  * What's included in the free trial?

- Pattern 4 (Alternative): Focus on switching
  * Why should I switch from {competitor}?
  * Is the migration easy?
  * Will I lose my existing content?
  * How much will I save?
  * What makes Sozee better?

- Pattern 5 (Review): Focus on evaluation
  * Is Sozee worth it for {audience}?
  * What are the pros and cons?
  * How much does Sozee cost?
  * What do real users say?
  * Who should NOT use Sozee?

- Pattern 6 (Crisis): Focus on the problem
  * What is the content crisis?
  * How does Sozee solve the 1/100 problem?
  * Can I really generate unlimited content?
  * Will fans notice it's AI?
  * What's the ROI for {audience}?

Format each as:
Q: [Question]
A: [Answer - 2-3 sentences, factual and helpful]

Key facts to include in answers:
- Custom LORA training takes 30 minutes
- Generate content in 30 seconds
- Hyper-realistic results (trained on YOUR face)
- Built for SFW and NSFW content
- Pricing: Creators $15/week, Agencies $33/week
- No technical skills required
- Industry operates on 1/100 supply vs demand ratio

Output 5 Q&A pairs.

meta_description.prompt_template:
Write a meta description (150-160 characters) for this landing page.

Page Title: {h1}
Pattern: {pattern_name}
Variables: {variables}

Meta description guidelines:
- Include the main target keyword naturally
- Make it compelling for click-through (not just descriptive)
- Include a benefit or hook
- End with a call-to-action phrase if possible
- Stay within 150-160 characters (CRITICAL)

Examples:
- Pattern 1: 'Compare Sozee and Higgsfield for OnlyFans creators. See features, pricing, and which AI content tool solves the content crisis.'
- Pattern 2: 'Discover the best AI photo generator for OnlyFans agencies. Solve the content crisis and scale without creator burnout.'
- Pattern 3: 'Professional OnlyFans AI photo generator. Generate unlimited hyper-realistic content and scale your brand without burnout.'

Output ONLY the meta description, nothing else.
